Description: Fragment of double handle at neck join, to sharp turn, from a Campanian pottery transport amphora. Clay medium light purplish brown; some mica; yellowish slip. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Latin inscription.
Curator's comments: Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 200, 67. The piece contains volcanic material; perhaps a Campanian imitation of Koan.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1348)
